description.en: The course will review the state of the art in robotics technology and discuss some future advancements. Special focus will be on using Robot Operating System (ROS) for solving practical problems in robotics.
description.et: Kursus annab ülevaate robotitehnoloogia kaasajast ning olulisematest arengusuundadest. Praktiliste näiteprobleemide lahendamiseks kasutatakse robootika platvormi ROS.

objectives.en: The main objectives of the course are to:
1) review the latest developments in robotics and related (e.g., sensors and software) technology,
objectives.et: 1) anda ülevaade robootika ning seotud tehnoloogia (nt andurid ja tarkvara) peamistest arengusuundadest,

objectives.en: 2) introduce the fundamental concepts of robotics technology,
3) give participants practical experience of using Robot Operating System (ROS).
objectives.et: 3) anda osalejatele praktiline kogemus robootika arendusplatvormi ROS kasutamises.

learning_outcomes.en: 1) can list example fields of robotics technology and explain the state-of-the-art in those fields;
learning_outcomes.et: 1) suudab loetleda näited robootika tehnoloogiast ning selgitada konkreetse valdkonna tehnikataset;

learning_outcomes.en: 2) can program ROS nodes using either C++ or Python;
learning_outcomes.et: 2) oskab programmeerida ROS-i sõlmesid kasutades programmeerimise keelt C++ või Python;

learning_outcomes.en: 3) is able to integrate existing ROS packages to a larger ROS-based project;
learning_outcomes.et: 3) oskab liita eri keerukuse ja suurusega ROS-i tarkvara ühtseks robootika projektiks;

learning_outcomes.en: 4) is familiar with and can describe the standard tools/packages of ROS, such as roslaunch, RViz, MoveIt!, Navigation, tf;
learning_outcomes.et: 4) oskab kasutada ja kirjeldada enimlevinud ROS-i töövahendeid ja tarkvara, nt roslaunch, RViz, MoveIt!, Navigation ja tf;

learning_outcomes.en: 5) can implement ROS-based solutions for most common robotics problems, e.g., coordinate transformation, path-planning, inverse kinematics, and collision-free motion planning.
learning_outcomes.et: 5) oskab ROS-i abil lahendada robootika olulisemaid probleeme nagu koordinaadi teisendused, rajaplaneerimine, pöördkinemaatika ja liikumise ajal kokkupõrgete vältimine.

independent_work.et: Two presentations that meet the specified criteria. Presentation topics must be approved by the lecturer in advance.

description.et: Student must complete all practical assignments by the end of the final scheduled lab. The completion will be assessed by the instructor at the end of every lab session.

Student gives a presentation on a ROS-based robotics project. The topic must be approved by a lecturer in advance.
The presentation yields up to 9 points of the final grade and is assessed based on 4 criteria:
1) correctness and quality of presented content,
2) clarity of presentation (including the structure of narrative),
3) quality and appropriateness of visual and/or any other aids during the presentation, and
4) presenter's ability to carry on a discussion on the topic.

Student gives a presentation on advanced robot technology/system. The topic must be approved by a lecturer in advance.
The presentation yields up to 9 points of the final grade and is assessed based on 4 criteria:
1) correctness and quality of presented content,
2) clarity of presentation (including the structure of narrative),
3) quality and appropriateness of visual and/or any other aids during the presentation, and
4) presenter's ability to carry on a discussion on the topic.
Final exam yields up to 32 points of the final grade.

grade_preconditions.et: Successful completion of all the practical assignments.

grade_evaluation.et:
Only the student who has successfully completed all the practical assignments is eligible for a positive grade.
There is a midterm on the academic week 32. Midterm requirement: the student has completed the first five lab assignments  by 4pm on Tuesday of academic week 32 (In 2025, the midterm deadline is April 8th). Failing to meet midterm requirement results in 15 point penalty on the final grade (i.e. 15 points are subtracted from the final amount of earned points).

1) Presentation on ROS-based robotics project (9 pts)
2) Presentation on advanced robot technology (9 pts)
3) Final exam (32 pts)

"A" - 41-50 points
"B" - 31-40 points
"C" - 21-30 points
"D" - 11-20 points
"E" - 1-10 points

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
